verses.verse: And it came<WH1961> to pass at the end<WH7093> of two full<WH3117> years,<WH8141> that Pharaoh<WH6547> dreamed:<WH2492> and, behold,<WH2009> he stood<WH5975> by the river.<WH2975>
And, behold,<WH2009> there came<WH5927> up out of the river<WH2975> seven<WH7651> well<WH3303> favored<WH4758> cows<WH6510> and fat;<WH1277> and they fed<WH7462> in a meadow.<WH260>

And, behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> other<WH312> cows<WH6510> came<WH5927> up after<WH310> them out of the river,<WH2975> ill<WH7451> favored<WH4758> and skinney;<WH1851> <WH1320> and stood<WH5975> by the other cows<WH6510> on the brink<WH8193> of the river.<WH2975>

And the ill<WH7451> favored<WH4758> and skinney<WH1851> <WH1320> cows<WH6510> did eat<WH398> up the seven<WH7651> well<WH3303> favored<WH4758> and fat<WH1277> cows.<WH6510> So Pharaoh<WH6547> awoke.<WH3364>
And he slept<WH3462> and dreamed<WH2492> the second<WH8145> time: and, behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> ears<WH7641> of corn came<WH5927> up on one<WH259> stalk,<WH7070> rank<WH1277> and good.<WH2896>
And, behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> thin<WH1851> ears<WH7641> and blasted<WH7710> with the east<WH6921> wind sprung<WH6779> up after<WH310> them.
And the seven thin<WH1851> ears<WH7641> devoured<WH1104> the seven<WH7651> rank<WH1277> and full<WH4392> ears.<WH7641> And Pharaoh<WH6547> awoke,<WH3364> and, behold,<WH2009> it was a dream.<WH2472>

And it came<WH1961> to pass in the morning<WH1242> that his spirit<WH7307> was troubled;<WH6470> and he sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> for all<WH3605> the magicians<WH2748> of Egypt,<WH4714> and all<WH3605> the wise<WH2450> men thereof: and Pharaoh<WH6547> told<WH5608> them his dream;<WH2472> but there was none<WH369> that could interpret<WH6622> them to Pharaoh.<WH6547>
Then spoke<WH1696> the chief<WH8269> butler<WH4945> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> saying,<WH559> I do remember<WH2142> my faults<WH2399> this day:<WH3117>

Pharaoh<WH6547> was wroth<WH7107> with his servants,<WH5650> and put<WH5414> me in ward<WH4929> in the captain<WH8269> of the guard's<WH2876> house,<WH1004> both me and the chief<WH8269> baker:<WH644>
And we dreamed<WH2492> a dream<WH2472> in one<WH259> night,<WH3915> I and he; we dreamed<WH2492> each man<WH376> according to the interpretation<WH6623> of his dream.<WH2472>

And there<WH8033> was there with us a young<WH5288> man,<WH376> an Hebrew,<WH5680> servant<WH5650> to the captain<WH8269> of the guard;<WH2876> and we told<WH5608> him, and he interpreted<WH6622> to us our dreams;<WH2472> to each man<WH376> according to his dream<WH2472> he did interpret.<WH6622>
And it came<WH1961> to pass, as he interpreted<WH6622> to us, so<WH3651> it was; me he restored<WH7725> to my office,<WH3653> and him he hanged.<WH8518>

Then Pharaoh<WH6547> sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> Joseph,<WH3130> and they brought<WH7323> him hastily<WH7323> out of the dungeon:<WH953> and he shaved<WH1548> himself, and changed<WH2498> his raiment,<WH8071> and came<WH935> in to Pharaoh.<WH6547>

And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> I have dreamed<WH2492> a dream,<WH2472> and there is none<WH369> that can interpret<WH6622> it: and I have heard<WH8085> say<WH559> of you, that you can understand<WH8085> a dream<WH2472> to interpret<WH6622> it.
And Joseph<WH3130> answered<WH6030> Pharaoh,<WH6547> saying,<WH559> It is not in me: God<WH430> shall give Pharaoh<WH6547> an answer<WH6030> of peace.<WH7965>
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH1696> to Joseph,<WH3130> In my dream,<WH2472> behold,<WH2005> I stood<WH5975> on the bank<WH8193> of the river:<WH2975>
And, behold,<WH2009> there came<WH5927> up out of the river<WH2975> seven<WH7651> cows,<WH6510> fat<WH1277> and well<WH3303> favored;<WH8389> and they fed<WH7462> in a meadow:<WH260>

And, behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> other<WH312> cows<WH6510> came<WH5927> up after<WH310> them, poor<WH1800> and very<WH3966> ill<WH7451> favored<WH8389> and skinney,<WH7534> such<WH2007> as I never<WH3808> saw<WH7200> in all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> for badness:<WH7455>
And the lean<WH7534> and the ill<WH7451> favored cows<WH6510> did eat<WH398> up the first<WH7223> seven<WH7651> fat<WH1277> cows:<WH6510>
And when they had eaten<WH935> them up, it could not be known<WH3045> that they had eaten<WH935> them; but they were still ill<WH7451> favored, as at the beginning.<WH8462> So I awoke.<WH3364>
And I saw<WH7200> in my dream,<WH2472> and, behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> ears<WH7641> came<WH5927> up in one<WH259> stalk,<WH7070> full<WH4392> and good:<WH2896>
And, behold,<WH2009> seven<WH7651> ears,<WH7641> withered,<WH6798> thin,<WH1851> and blasted<WH7710> with the east<WH6921> wind, sprung<WH6779> up after<WH310> them:

And the thin<WH1851> ears<WH7641> devoured<WH1104> the seven<WH7651> good<WH2896> ears:<WH7641> and I told<WH559> this to the magicians;<WH2748> but there was none<WH369> that could declare<WH5046> it to me.
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> The dream<WH2472> of Pharaoh<WH6547> is one:<WH259> God<WH430> has showed<WH5046> Pharaoh<WH6547> what<WH853> <WH834> he is about to do.<WH6213>
The seven<WH7651> good<WH2896> cows<WH6510> are seven<WH7651> years;<WH8141> and the seven<WH7651> good<WH2896> ears<WH7641> are seven<WH7651> years:<WH8141> the dream<WH2472> is one.<WH259>

And the seven<WH7651> thin<WH7534> and ill<WH7451> favored cows<WH6510> that came<WH5927> up after<WH310> them are seven<WH7651> years;<WH8141> and the seven<WH7651> empty<WH7386> ears<WH7641> blasted<WH7710> with the east<WH6921> wind shall be seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of famine.<WH7458>
This<WH1931> is the thing<WH1697> which<WH834> I have spoken<WH1696> to Pharaoh:<WH6547> What<WH834> God<WH430> is about to do<WH6213> he shows<WH7200> to Pharaoh.<WH6547>
Behold,<WH2009> there come<WH935> seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of great<WH1419> plenty<WH7647> throughout all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt:<WH4714>

And there shall arise<WH6965> after<WH310> them seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of famine;<WH7458> and all<WH3605> the plenty<WH7647> shall be forgotten<WH7911> in the land<WH776> of Egypt;<WH4714> and the famine<WH7458> shall consume<WH3615> the land;<WH776>
And the plenty<WH7647> shall not be known<WH3045> in the land<WH776> by reason<WH6440> of that famine<WH7458> following;<WH310> <WH3651> for it shall be very<WH3966> grievous.<WH3515>

And for that the dream<WH2472> was doubled<WH8138> to Pharaoh<WH6547> twice;<WH6471> it is because<WH3588> the thing<WH1697> is established<WH3559> by God,<WH430> and God<WH430> will shortly<WH4116> bring<WH6213> it to pass.<WH6213>
Now therefore let Pharaoh<WH6547> look<WH7200> out a man<WH376> discreet<WH995> and wise,<WH2450> and set<WH7896> him over<WH5921> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

Let Pharaoh<WH6547> do<WH6213> this, and let him appoint<WH6485> officers<WH6496> over<WH5921> the land,<WH776> and take up the fifth<WH2567> part of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> in the seven<WH7651> plenteous<WH7647> years.<WH8141>

And let them gather<WH6908> all<WH3605> the food<WH400> of those<WH428> good<WH2896> years<WH8141> that come,<WH935> and lay<WH6651> up corn<WH1250> under<WH8478> the hand<WH3027> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> and let them keep<WH8104> food<WH400> in the cities.<WH5892>

And that food<WH400> shall be for store<WH6487> to the land<WH776> against the seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of famine,<WH7458> which<WH834> shall be in the land<WH776> of Egypt;<WH4714> that the land<WH776> perish<WH3772> not through the famine.<WH7458>
And the thing<WH1697> was good<WH3190> in the eyes<WH5869> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> and in the eyes<WH5869> of all<WH3605> his servants.<WH5650>
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to his servants,<WH5650> Can we find<WH4672> such a one as this<WH2088> is, a man<WH376> in whom<WH834> the Spirit<WH7307> of God<WH430> is?

And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> For as much<WH310> as God<WH430> has showed<WH3045> you all<WH3605> this,<WH2063> there is none<WH369> so discreet<WH995> and wise<WH2450> as you are:

You shall be over<WH5921> my house,<WH1004> and according<WH5921> to your word<WH6310> shall all<WH3605> my people<WH5971> be ruled:<WH5401> only<WH7535> in the throne<WH3678> will I be greater<WH1431> than you.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> See,<WH7200> I have set<WH5414> you over<WH5921> all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And Pharaoh<WH6547> took<WH5493> off his ring<WH2885> from his hand,<WH3027> and put<WH5414> it on Joseph's<WH3130> hand,<WH3027> and arrayed<WH3847> him in clothing<WH899> of fine linen,<WH8336> and put<WH7760> a gold<WH2091> chain<WH7242> about<WH5921> his neck;<WH6677>

And he made him to ride<WH7392> in the second<WH4932> chariot<WH4818> which<WH834> he had; and they cried<WH7121> before<WH6440> him, Bow<WH86> the knee: and he made<WH5414> him ruler over<WH5921> all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> I am Pharaoh,<WH6547> and without<WH1107> you shall no<WH3808> man<WH376> lift<WH7311> up his hand<WH3027> or foot<WH7272> in all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And Pharaoh<WH6547> called<WH7121> Joseph's<WH3130> name<WH8034> Zaphnathpaaneah;<WH6847> and he gave<WH5414> him to wife<WH802> Asenath<WH621> the daughter<WH1323> of Potipherah<WH6319> priest<WH3548> of On.<WH204> And Joseph<WH3130> went<WH3318> out over<WH5921> all the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And Joseph<WH3130> was thirty<WH7970> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> Pharaoh<WH6547> king<WH4428> of Egypt.<WH4714> And Joseph<WH3130> went<WH3318> out from the presence<WH6440> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> and went<WH5674> throughout all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>
And in the seven<WH7651> plenteous<WH7647> years<WH8141> the earth<WH776> brought<WH6213> forth<WH6213> by handfuls.<WH7062>

And he gathered<WH6908> up all<WH3605> the food<WH400> of the seven<WH7651> years,<WH8141> which<WH834> were in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and laid<WH5414> up the food<WH400> in the cities:<WH5892> the food<WH400> of the field,<WH7704> which<WH834> was round<WH5439> about every city,<WH5892> laid<WH5414> he up in the same.

And Joseph<WH3130> gathered<WH6651> corn<WH1250> as the sand<WH2344> of the sea,<WH3220> very<WH3966> much,<WH7235> until<WH5704> he left<WH2308> numbering;<WH5608> for it was without<WH369> number.<WH4557>

And to Joseph<WH3130> were born<WH3205> two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> before<WH2962> the years<WH8141> of famine<WH7458> came,<WH935> which<WH834> Asenath<WH621> the daughter<WH1323> of Potipherah<WH6319> priest<WH3548> of On<WH204> bore<WH3205> to him.

And Joseph<WH3130> called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the firstborn<WH1060> Manasseh:<WH4519> For God,<WH430> said he, has made me forget<WH5382> all<WH3605> my toil,<WH5999> and all<WH3605> my father's<WH1> house.<WH1004>
And the name<WH8034> of the second<WH8145> called<WH7121> he Ephraim:<WH669> For God<WH430> has caused me to be fruitful<WH6509> in the land<WH776> of my affliction.<WH6040>
And the seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of plenty,<WH7647> that was in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> were ended.<WH3615>

And the seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> of dearth<WH7458> began<WH2490> to come,<WH935> according as Joseph<WH3130> had said:<WH559> and the dearth<WH7458> was in all<WH3605> lands;<WH776> but in all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> there was bread.<WH3899>

And when all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> was famished,<WH7456> the people<WH5971> cried<WH6817> to Pharaoh<WH6547> for bread:<WH3899> and Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to all<WH3605> the Egyptians,<WH4714> Go<WH3212> to Joseph;<WH3130> what<WH834> he said<WH559> to you, do.<WH6213>

And the famine<WH7458> was over<WH5921> all<WH3605> the face<WH6440> of the earth:<WH776> and Joseph<WH3130> opened<WH6605> all<WH3605> the storehouses,<WH834> and sold<WH7666> to the Egyptians;<WH4714> and the famine<WH7458> waxed sore<WH2388> in the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>
And all<WH3605> countries<WH776> came<WH935> into Egypt<WH4714> to Joseph<WH3130> for to buy<WH7666> corn; because<WH3588> that the famine<WH7458> was so sore<WH2388> in all<WH3605> lands.<WH776>
